title: Opinion: Nerfing Jungle actually made it more of a deciding factor in games
body:
Like...THE deciding factor in most games now.

When Jungle is strong you have jungle mains and people wanting to get into it trying it, and rarely autofills that do not want to play it or are not proficient at a level of being detrimental to the team

When you nerf it to where Jungle is hitting 6 at the same time as, or after the Bot Lane, it's not considered fun, so you lose a lot of mains to playing top or mid instead, and you have the people trying it for fun who are naturally okay at it avoiding it like the plague

In-turn you end up in most games with the coinflip of all coinflip issues that have plagued 2019(all jungle related go figure) where you have a jungle main versus an autofilled ADC main playing jungle(seems to be the most commonly autofilled roll to end up as jungler with a lot of duos playing duo bot lane) and the skill disparity is so high that the team with the autofilled Jungler has often lost by roughly 8 minutes in with top and mid being camped to shit by an Olaf or Lee Sin, and then bot lane being crushed if eventually by the now winning mid top and jungle if they aren't losing already. 

It seems like the game is much healthier when people want to play each role for one reason or another, when Support was so bad no one would play it willingly the game was awful. Now that Jungle is that way, the game has never felt worse, in conjunction with damage being way too high and CC remaining unchanged / growing with every new champion created.

replies.body: Jungle has always had a pretty big impact on the game.. what the new jungle has created is a situation where one teams jungler is going to be useless..and causes an almost auto loss because they have no way to catch up and have any impact at all after they make their first mistake..

> [{quoted}](name=IVSakenz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2020-01-02T18:28:41.331+0000)
>
> Jungle has always had a pretty big impact on the game.. what the new jungle has created is a situation where one teams jungler is going to be useless..and causes an almost auto loss because they have no way to catch up and have any impact at all after they make their first mistake..

Exactly, so if you're on the team with the autofilled jungler, the one that isn't as good, doesn't make a good jungle pick, or doesn't get olaf / lee sin / eve it seems like you just lose now. Damage needs to be lowered like crazy games ending at 15 minutes and then dragging on to 25+ because people don't know how to close out is awful
god forbid a worlds game lasts more than 15 minutes...they'll never go for that.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosReyn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-04T02:55:56.674+0000)
>
> god forbid a worlds game lasts more than 15 minutes...they'll never go for that.

I don't know if there's ever been one that's been that short.
well, the point is. anything that starts lasting past like 25-30 minutes starts pissing off the worlds scheduling staff. and the meme is theyve been trying to make game times shorter every year.

As a jungle main it hurts me to say this, but the best way to balance the role is to reduce its impact and completely gut getting ahead.

Basically. Give it massive catchup XP, but balance the XP in a way that you are on the same level as the bot lane.

This way your jungler can never fall behind, but they are never strong enough to have a massive impact on the game.

Only 1 problem with this. You thought jungle was the Autofill role now.

To be fair, I have queued up for support/jg multiple times in the past few days while playing solo, and every time I get jg. If I don't put jg on my two roles, and happen to get autofilled, it is to jungle. I have noticed that no one wants to play the role at all anymore, because being a level or two behind your bot lane if you happen to get killed once or twice early god damn sucks. 

Even playing traditionally high impact junglers I feel like I'm delegated to farming drakes and setting up vision for most of the game because that's the only way I'm useful. Forget ganking the toplane who is two to three levels ahead of you if your toplaner is even or behind, mid is a little better, and you can gank bot if you think you can live off assists because ADC needs the kills so badly at this point.

Idk. I've been a jungle main for seasons now, and I get that some of it is just resistance to change, but I'm just swapping out and going to support where I feel more like a jungler than I do actually playing jungle (plus they now have all the fun champs)

> [{quoted}](name=Leblonsh,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2020-01-03T16:57:46.802+0000)

Forget ganking the toplane who is two to three levels ahead of you if your toplaner is even or behind, mid is a little better, and you can gank bot if you think you can live off assists because ADC needs the kills so badly at this point.
> 
> Idk. I've been a jungle main for seasons now, and I get that some of it is just resistance to change, but I'm just swapping out and going to support where I feel more like a jungler than I do actually playing jungle (plus they now have all the fun champs)

Just tell me how? I literally queues 300 games this season support primary jg secondary role, and got jg once.
ngl I have no idea. That has just been my experience. Maybe cause I used to be a jungle main?

Honestly, I really enjoy S10 jungle. I've been maining jungle Since S3 and this Jungle is one of my favorites. It's so objective-based that I find it fun.

In previous seasons it was "Eh so what if they get that clown drake" Now every drake has such importance that it makes it much more fun for me. Instead of tank junglers, I'm playing playmakers like Elise. Focusing around getting the dragons and facilitating my team. It's a relief from feeling like I had to be a carry role. So I really do personally enjoy this more objective-based supportive jungle. (Though my friend who basically only plays Rengar when he jungles really doesn't like it.)

> [{quoted}](name=Rewt,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-03T21:15:07.017+0000)
>
> Honestly, I really enjoy S10 jungle. I've been maining jungle Since S3 and this Jungle is one of my favorites. It's so objective-based that I find it fun.

Instead of tank junglers, I'm playing playmakers like Elise. Focusing around getting the dragons and facilitating my team. It's a relief from feeling like I had to be a carry role. So I really do personally enjoy this more objective-based supportive jungle. (Though my friend who basically only plays Rengar when he jungles really doesn't like it.)

It's not, it's like Lee has 7 kills while I am taking lvl 5 drake that is t important at all if your enemy use snowball to get next 4.

well no shit if the jungler has had 7 successful ganks that will outweigh your 1 drake.

You should be warding and killing scuttle to try and track the enemy jungler and preform a countergank.
https://cdn.lynda.com/video/185099-56-635435848809818082_338x600_thumb.jpg
I have this nasty habit of reading things as they are written. When there are no periods I mentally run out of breath.
Right! I gave up tbh.

That happens when riot guts jungle into the dirt and makes it so punishing it’s borderline impossible to come back. 

One mistake. And I mean ONE mistake and it’s over. You lose. It doesn’t even have to be a huge mistake. 
You didn’t get a good leash and had to burn smite on your second camp? Looks like you’re getting double scuttled and invaded for the rest of the game. 

You had to go help top because your baby bitch top laner wouldn’t stop crying? 
There goes dragon, bot turret and a double for the enemy jungler. 

Junglers are in a damned if you do damned if you don’t state.

This is more or less what peopled asked for tho (although maybe on the extreme end). Junglers complained for ages how it didn't matter how well they played because the enemy could just come back with the catch-up XP. They wanted enemies that were behind to stay behind no matter what.
It's always been like that and will always be like that. People want to be able to solo carry, but god have mercy if the enemy is able to solo carry. They don't stop to think that for some games they'll be on the receiving end of that.

> [{quoted}](name=Leetri,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2020-01-03T22:09:38.705+0000)

No this is what the hashinshins of this game wanted. Junglers weren’t happy before because riot fucked scaling so you could ONLY play early pressure junglers. To which the hashinshins cried out even harder because go figure they don’t want to be camped every game by default. And thus riot nerfed junglers early game without ever buffing back their late.
{{champion:203}} lategame is a monster tho

> [{quoted}](name=MuffledGarbage,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-04T00:43:34.347+0000)
>
> {{champion:203}} lategame is a monster tho

Sure. Maybe full build. Which never happens. And even when it does happen, happens 20 minutes after the laners. So you’ve just been getting bent over unwillingly for 20 minutes just to be on par with everyone else.

well I mean kindred scales up fast after getting 7 hunts thanks to the extra range + damage. 7 hunts happens relatively fast and kindred's range being increased means if you take {{item:3094}} you are basically guaranteed first shot every time no matter what meaning you win almost every 1v1 due to crit damage + range + attack speed advantage...

but all that is only after a lot of hunts which happens more often later in the game

> [{quoted}](name=MuffledGarbage,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-04T06:12:38.080+0000)

And unfortunetly hunts are almost all rng and enemy reliant.

funny how, before, everyone HATED being auto filled support and it was the MOST autofilled role. Now its mostly fucking jungle autofill which is EVEN worse to someone who has BARELY played jg, and as a laner YOU FEEL it. Getting ganked? nope hes doing his blue at 23 hp trying not to die. Dragon up? well hes in the enemy jg trying to clear raptors

they did 3 jgl changes when only 2 were needed, said it already but hey no one is listening so let's wait for the season to end first.
it's better than last season regardless.

> [{quoted}](name=2gudaiya,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2020-01-02T18:32:51.908+0000)

If they don't make some changes to how the game is right now, this could possibly be the season that kills the game or hurts the player base so much that it can't survive future seasons. The game feels like coinflips every single matchup, jungle is awful, hell every role feels awful to play like there's no role where you feel like the game is in your control or any fun anymore because whatever you play the rest of your team is feeding
it also ends up favoring early ganks and gank heavy junglers, making it more oppressive on the laners

> [{quoted}](name=Hella Kaiser,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=0013,timestamp=2020-01-03T21:23:14.696+0000)
>
> it also ends up favoring early ganks and gank heavy junglers, making it more oppressive on the laners

not the best feeling, seems like it's geared toward LCS BIG PLAYZ#
If you read, with the shorter respawn timers straight farming is more efficient and actually higher than last season.

The more unforgiving the JG role is the more important it becomes.... right up to the point you're better off running a top lane support instead. I was trying to play some Shyv lately and the game is almost over by the time you hit 6. I have played (gold/plat) against Lee or Elise who just lvl 3 gank top, then walk down the river THROUGH WARDS and gank mid, then bot. Vision and many pings by me do not stop each lane from dying repeatedly. In the current meta you HAVE to be there to gank first or counter-gank.

You have no time to scale. If you lose pri in mid you lose all crabs and objectives and god help you if their mid roams with their jg. Once you OR YOUR LANES are behind now, you have no jungle to farm.

> [{quoted}](name=muted team chat,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2020-01-03T17:54:51.809+0000)

> You have no time to scale. If you lose pri in mid you lose all crabs and objectives and god help you if their mid roams with their jg. Once you OR YOUR LANES are behind now, you have no jungle to farm.

That's the worst part about the game now is (in gold) the games are over well before lane phase ends, and lane phase is 1/2 the length it was a couple years ago since turrets do nothing now. On my plat account the games actually seem slower...like people are in roles they chose so the inting isn't quite as bad, but in gold I feel like i'm on my first back to get B.F. sword and top is 0/3, mid is 0/3 jungle is 0/1 - 0/3 and it's like well, may as well buy tear of the goddess, game is pretty much done unless their jungler and mid come bot and int me a quadra and i start playing like a challenger player just to pull out a win in gold

I would prefer duo top and bot at this point, the game is just so bad in its current state.
Lol that lee is me every game I get autofilled. Gank every lane before 5 minutes and usually get both scuttles. If most of my ganks resulted in kills I can actually get warrior first back.
game was in a way better state when nobody wanted to play support and you can't convince me otherwise

> [{quoted}](name=iLLp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2020-01-03T17:04:16.477+0000)

I could see that if you were a mid / top or JG main sure. easier to gank bot lane and get fed there to carry

> [{quoted}](name=S Tier Waifu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=00100000,timestamp=2020-01-03T17:06:03.499+0000)

i was playing mid and support during those phases and enjoying the game. during those times team fights didn't = who blows up first. there was more strategy and skill involved. now everybody just picks something that does insane damage and see who can put their damage out first.

And is this not an indication that the jungle is too strong?

If the good jungler wins by succeeding a couple of ganks early while the autofilled one farms is it not a question of whenever we should ask Riot to gut the junglers so the good one cant win in that manner so easily? Like the autofilled one did not even do anything wrong really, did not die or give up CS. 

I am still gona spell it out, failing as a jungler sucks more now compared to before but the role still has too much impact, a good one can easily decide how a lane goes if the two there are not too far apart in skill.

Even if they are the jungler can still camp to make up for it if his side is the losing one, aspiring faker wont be strong once he´s died 3 times no matter what kinda plays he tries to come up with. 

 
Toplane? 1/4th of the lane is knowing your champ, another 4th is knowing the enemy one and the last 50% is knowing how the two junglers move around because if you get caught and die at a bad time you´ve autolost the lane against a good opponent. 

Heck its even enough to be forced to recall at the wrong time in some cases. 

Midlane? Watch that assassin snowball into a avalanche.

Botlane? Dragon soul inc. 

The jungler has the fastest way to setoff any snowball and all it takes is i´d say two ganks to make or break the game if lucky/unlucky.

Impact my ass, bot lane determines games 100% of the time. I get my tristana 3 early kills and she still manages to lose mid to late game to the lane I helped feed her on.

What do you suggest they do if they nerf ganks? I now have to farm as Rammus or Eve and die to Udyr/Lee Sin/Olaf invading my jungle and taking my camps 24/7 because if you emphasize farm xp, it becomes a game of who has the better duelist jungle to invade all camps and take xp from the enemy jungle who can't catch up.

Ganking is virtually the only way weak duelist junglers can catch up in xp and gold from strong duelists like Udyr and Olaf who can invade you all game long.

> [{quoted}](name=Crescent Dusk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2020-01-03T02:07:02.706+0000)
>
> Impact my ass, bot lane determines games 100% of the time. I get my tristana 3 early kills and she still manages to lose mid to late game to the lane I helped feed her on.

.....Is this not just a case of the Tristana throwing the game though?  You feeding her will not matter if she insists on throwing it away. 


> What do you suggest they do if they nerf ganks? I now have to farm as Rammus or Eve and die to Udyr/Lee Sin/Olaf invading my jungle and taking my camps 24/7 because if you emphasize farm xp, it becomes a game of who has the better duelist jungle to invade all camps and take xp from the enemy jungle who can't catch up.
>
> Ganking is virtually the only way weak duelist junglers can catch up in xp and gold from strong duelists like Udyr and Olaf who can invade you all game long.

Nerf the ability to gank early, nerf duelists additionally and equalize farming more overall early on, If everyone has a more equal starting point then skill&luck determines who ends up pulling ahead. 

Why do this? 

Because it´s utterly fucking terrible to sit in lane, hit level 2-3 and then suddenly that level 3 {{champion:154}} /{{champion:164}} {{champion:59}}  comes flying in and you have just lost the ability to do anything for the rest of the game from there on, your opponent might even snowball hard enough to carry his team from there on. 

Normally that´s what would happen when a Tristana gets 3 kills early on as well, she´d just hard carry and with that kit the enemy team would have no way to stop her but alas, takes the person in question having a modicum of good sense to accomplish that.


At this time when the jungle is anywhere near good everyone, literally everyone everyone else suffers for it, especially toplane who lacks any way to make an impact on the map even when ahead aside from Herald which is still a rather crappy objective compared to Dragons. 

Midlane? Starts roaming everywhere or scales into a teamfight monster.

Botlane? Dragon soul inc+whatever the marksman+support pair is good at. 

Jungle fed? Dragon soul, herald and ganks&invades for days inc.

Toplane fed? Herald........which is made useless if the enemy jungle happens to be nearby to help stop it fast enough.

I made the suggestion that herald and dragon spawns should alternate sides and got downvoted to oblivion. Got forbid top lane got an objective worth a damn early. At the very least they could make herald charge one shot a tower period or at least give the top lane minions and person who got herald the baron buff so you'd have 2 lane push pressure.

> [{quoted}](name=S Tier Waifu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=,timestamp=2020-01-02T18:14:30.278+0000)
>
> Like...THE deciding factor in most games now.
> 
> When Jungle is strong you have jungle mains and people wanting to get into it trying it, and rarely autofills that do not want to play it or are not proficient at a level of being detrimental to the team
> 
> When you nerf it to where Jungle is hitting 6 at the same time as, or after the Bot Lane, it's not considered fun, so you lose a lot of mains to playing top or mid instead, and you have the people trying it for fun who are naturally okay at it avoiding it like the plague
> 
> In-turn you end up in most games with the coinflip of all coinflip issues that have plagued 2019(all jungle related go figure) where you have a jungle main versus an autofilled ADC main playing jungle(seems to be the most commonly autofilled roll to end up as jungler with a lot of duos playing duo bot lane) and the skill disparity is so high that the team with the autofilled Jungler has often lost by roughly 8 minutes in with top and mid being camped to shit by an Olaf or Lee Sin, and then bot lane being crushed if eventually by the now winning mid top and jungle if they aren't losing already. 
> 
> It seems like the game is much healthier when people want to play each role for one reason or another, when Support was so bad no one would play it willingly the game was awful. Now that Jungle is that way, the game has never felt worse, in conjunction with damage being way too high and CC remaining unchanged / growing with every new champion created.

It's nothing to do with autofills, stop looking for scapegoats.

Jungle is right now the only role without any way to catch up the moment it's put behind, and often being put behind comes down to two factors: you can't duel the enemy jungler because their champ is a stronger duelist than you and can invade you, or your lanes don't give you priority for scuttles and objectives or feed the enemy jungle kills by overextending without vision while you're in the other side of the map.

Imagine playing Annie vs. Xerath, except there are no turrets. That's how jungle is, because the enemy jungler that's put ahead can come invade you 24/7 and take your only form of XP, and so can enemy laners who you can no longer duel because even the enemy bot lane is the same or one level above you while the other lanes are 2-3 levels over you after your first clear.

You are a second worse support now that lives and dies by being able to get a successful gank at lv2-3 because by lv3 is the last time you'll be around the same level as enemy laners. By the time you get lv5 top lane will be lv7. Mid lane will be close to that as well. 

And unlike support, you not only are giving your item slot for a jungle item like they are for their support item, you are giving up a summoner spell as well. You are objectively weaker than anyone but a support, and even some supports like Brand or Fiddlesticks can 1v1 you as something like an Evelynn jungle.

As a jungler you no longer have agency and the capacity to get ahead and duel out enemy lanes to re-establish priority in any lane or river. If your laners aren't winning lane on their own, you are not going to be able to do anything either.

I started a game where I got my Tristana 3 early kills as Evelynn against the enemy Ezreal and Malphite. Didn't matter, she took my kills and did nothing with them, as by midgame the malphite and ezreal played the sieging game, ezreal got his manamune and started poking people for half their health over walls, and malphite ulted whatever got on the fed enemy Syndra and won pretty much every teamfight that way.

Point is, you can even get your lanes kills, and end up with nothing because in the end the quality of the laning players is the only thing that matters.

Another game I played Shaco/MF, with me as shaco autofilled support. The enemy Lee Sin was 4/1 by minute 5, didn't matter because as shaco I got my MF 2 kills for her and 2 kills for me on the enemy Nami. Lee Sin comes in for a gank, I simply ignite him and QE him without him even landing on one of my boxes and the MF runs him down in melee range before he can burst her down with a landed Q combo.

That's how jungle currently is, where you can get fed and at best while fed be even in levels with enemy laners but still weaker than a fed laner. Lanes matter more than jungle, and the only reason jungle exists is to smite dragons if allowed the priority over objectives by his lanes.

You HAVE to play some busted early snowball champ like Rengar, Olaf, Rek'sai, or Lee Sin to play the game now, and even then it's no guarantee and regardless you fall off hard by lv10 compared to enemy lanes. The job of the jungler now more than ever is to make sure winning lanes snowball even harder before 10 so you can comfortably take dragons and baron.

Watch a rcent game with TF Blade where tyhe enemy Ekko jungle has 9/1 and is lv14 while TF's Vayne top is lv15 with 7/5 KDA and is able to kill a fed ekko jg thanks to the xp jungle changes. If an Ekko jg before the jungle nerfs were 9/1, he would easily be lv16 by that point, not 14.

> [{quoted}](name=Crescent Dusk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=w9GNuqFp,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2020-01-03T02:03:36.264+0000)
>
> It's nothing to do with autofills, stop looking for scapegoats.
> 
> Jungle is right now the only role without any way to catch up the moment it's put behind, and often being put behind comes down to two factors: you can't duel the enemy jungler because their champ is a stronger duelist than you and can invade you, or your lanes don't give you priority for scuttles and objectives or feed the enemy jungle kills by overextending without vision while you're in the other side of the map.
> 
> Imagine playing Annie vs. Xerath, except there are no turrets. That's how jungle is, because the enemy jungler that's put ahead can come invade you 24/7 and take your only form of XP, and so can enemy laners who you can no longer duel because even the enemy bot lane is the same or one level above you while the other lanes are 2-3 levels over you after your first clear.
> 
> You are a second worse support now that lives and dies by being able to get a successful gank at lv2-3 because by lv3 is the last time you'll be around the same level as enemy laners. By the time you get lv5 top lane will be lv7. Mid lane will be close to that as well. 
> 
> And unlike support, you not only are giving your item slot for a jungle item like they are for their support item, you are giving up a summoner spell as well. You are objectively weaker than anyone but a support, and even some supports like Brand or Fiddlesticks can 1v1 you as something like an Evelynn jungle.
> 
> As a jungler you no longer have agency and the capacity to get ahead and duel out enemy lanes to re-establish priority in any lane or river. If your laners aren't winning lane on their own, you are not going to be able to do anything either.
> 
> I started a game where I got my Tristana 3 early kills as Evelynn against the enemy Ezreal and Malphite. Didn't matter, she took my kills and did nothing with them, as by midgame the malphite and ezreal played the sieging game, ezreal got his manamune and started poking people for half their health over walls, and malphite ulted whatever got on the fed enemy Syndra and won pretty much every teamfight that way.
> 
> Point is, you can even get your lanes kills, and end up with nothing because in the end the quality of the laning players is the only thing that matters.
> 
> Another game I played Shaco/MF, with me as shaco autofilled support. The enemy Lee Sin was 4/1 by minute 5, didn't matter because as shaco I got my MF 2 kills for her and 2 kills for me on the enemy Nami. Lee Sin comes in for a gank, I simply ignite him and QE him without him even landing on one of my boxes and the MF runs him down in melee range before he can burst her down with a landed Q combo.
> 
> That's how jungle currently is, where you can get fed and at best while fed be even in levels with enemy laners but still weaker than a fed laner. Lanes matter more than jungle, and the only reason jungle exists is to smite dragons if allowed the priority over objectives by his lanes.
> 
> You HAVE to play some busted early snowball champ like Rengar, Olaf, Rek'sai, or Lee Sin to play the game now, and even then it's no guarantee and regardless you fall off hard by lv10 compared to enemy lanes. The job of the jungler now more than ever is to make sure winning lanes snowball even harder before 10 so you can comfortably take dragons and baron.
> 
> Watch a rcent game with TF Blade where tyhe enemy Ekko jungle has 9/1 and is lv14 while TF's Vayne top is lv15 with 7/5 KDA and is able to kill a fed ekko jg thanks to the xp jungle changes. If an Ekko jg before the jungle nerfs were 9/1, he would easily be lv16 by that point, not 14.

if you don't do the ganks you will not recover.

5 weeks ago, people were downvoting posts with a 100 replies that said the jungle was in a bad place and should be fixed. Everyone hated the gank meta last season, so this seemed like an improvement, to which I have to agree, it is.  HOWEVER, I predicted in every post about the jungle, that it would become the most autofilled role and make people the most unhappy about the state of the jungle, that it has ever been in. And here we are 5 weeks later.

The solution is simple, boost the XP of the 2nd/3rd/4th jungle spawn. No catchup XP. Remove solo lane XP boost. Keep the lane sharing XP nerf (that will modestly disincentivize ganking and shoving wave, as will the lack of catchup XP in jungle).  This way, junglers are actually rewarded for clearing camps efficiently and not spam ganking.
